page.title: 13Rural Landscape
page.content: The landscape of the area has changed over the last thirty years due to the increase in field size as a result of mechanisation. This change has been slow and not too harsh. The woodland has remained unaltered and although some marshland has been ploughed the overall effect remains as it did years ago. The area is considered to be of great natural beauty wiht its gently sweeping arable fields interspersed with alder carr and woodland, and the wide open marshes to the east. Many old farm buildings remain eg. thatched barns, cartsheds and farm cottages. Modern buildings such as asbestos sheds and corn silos have been erected but within a couple of years they become covered with litchens or mosses and this helps to blend them into the landscape.
